channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.description: The latest stories from the Europe section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bulgaria PM to resign over protests
item.description: Bulgaria's government is resigning following nationwide protests against austerity and high electricity prices, PM Boiko Borisov says.

item.title: Ukraine ex-leader accused over death
item.description: A Ukrainian prosecutor says the there is evidence former President Leonid Kuchma was involved in the 2000 killing of journalist Georgy Gongadze.

item.title: Outrage over Berlusconi tax letter
item.description: Opponents accuse Silvio Berlusconi of trying to buy votes in Sunday's election by sending out letters promising a tax rebate.

item.title: Putin ally quits over foreign homes
item.description: A senior figure in Russian President Vladimir Putin's party resigns after anti-corruption campaigners accuse him of owning homes in the US.

item.title: Pope studying conclave rules changes
item.description: The Pope is considering changes to Catholic Church rules, which may speed up the process to select his successor, the Vatican says.

item.title: France urges Cameroon evacuation
item.description: France urges its citizens to leave north Cameroon "as quickly as possible" after seven of its nationals were kidnapped by gunmen on Tuesday.

item.title: Beheading suspect 'looked inhuman'
item.description: A British couple tell a court in Tenerife the man accused of stabbing a 60-year-old grandmother to death and decapitating her 'did not look human'.

item.title: Greece hit by fresh strike chaos
item.description: Widespread disruption hits Greece as thousands of people join the first general strike of 2013 against austerity measures.

item.title: Top US General John Allen to retire
item.description: US General John Allen has decided to retire instead of taking over as Nato's supreme commander in Europe, citing concerns about his wife's health.

item.title: Huge diamond robbery in Brussels
item.description: Armed robbers disguised as police escape with a massive haul of diamonds after a rapid raid at Brussels Airport, Belgian police say.

item.title: Irish PM in apology over laundries
item.description: The Irish Prime Minister, Enda Kenny, formally apologises on behalf of the Irish state for its role in the Magdalene laundries.

item.title: Russia probes 'murder' of US adoptee
item.description: Russia opens a murder inquiry into the death of a three-year-old Russian boy adopted in the US, but the US says abuse allegations remain unproven.

item.title: Norway TV's slow-burning wood drama
item.description: Norwegian public television broadcasts a special programme which features a burning fireplace - for 12 hours.

item.title: Romanian film wins top Berlin prize
item.description: The Romanian film Child's Pose picks up the Golden Bear for best film at the Berlin film festival, while an unemployed Bosnian Roma wins best actor.

item.title: UK unemployment total falls to 2.5m
item.description: UK unemployment fell in the three months to December, while the number in work also jumped to a new record, official figures show.

item.title: Record loss at Credit Agricole
item.description: French bank Credit Agricole reports a worse-than-expected annual loss after an unexpected tax charge pushes it deeper into the red.

item.title: VIDEO: European Commission
item.description: The Taxation Commissioner announces details of EU financial transaction tax.

item.title: VIDEO: Dementia: Pioneering city of Bruges
item.description: Bruges is recognised as a pioneering city in how it deals with dementia.

item.title: VIDEO: Foreign sailors 'stranded' in UK
item.description: The Russian captain and Ukrainian crew of a British-owned freighter 'trapped' in the port of Rye Wharf in south-east England following a legal dispute say they have run out of money and have no way to return home.

item.title: VIDEO: Greece faces fresh strike chaos
item.description: Greece's two biggest labour unions will bring much of the country to a standstill on Wednesday during a 24-hour strike over austerity measures.

item.title: VIDEO: Irish PM's tearful laundries apology
item.description: Irish Prime Minister Enda Kenny has formally apologised on behalf of the state for its role in the Magdalene laundries.

item.title: VIDEO: Voters' views from a 'broken' Italy
item.description: The BBC's Katya Adler reports from the Tuscan seaside town of Viareggio on how people are feeling ahead of Italy's general election.

item.title: VIDEO: 'We slept in the sewers with rats'
item.description: Newsnight's Paul Mason reports on one man, 26-year-old Mohamed Lamhoud from Morocco, who has spent more than a year on the road trying to claim asylum in Greece.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Gigantic' diamond heist in Brussels
item.description: Armed robbers have made off with a "gigantic" haul of diamonds after a rapid raid at Brussels Airport.

item.title: VIDEO: Iberia workers strike over cuts
item.description: Workers at the Spanish airline Iberia have begun a five-day strike in protest at planned cuts to jobs and salaries.

item.title: Italy: Berlusconi spots his opening
item.description: Europe nervous as Berlusconi hits campaign trail

item.title: Is nepotism holding Italy back?
item.description: How nepotism keeps talented young Italians out of work

item.title: Greece asylum: Journey through a broken system
item.description: One migrant's story of trying to claim asylum on Europe's frontier

item.title: Murder epidemic stains Corsica's image
item.description: The killings staining an island's picture postcard image

item.title: Chinese buy up Bordeaux's wines
item.description: How China's consumers are turning to Bordeaux

item.title: Kosovo celebrates fifth birthday
item.description: Kosovo marks independence birthday, but not all are celebrating

item.title: How the horse is at the heart of Romanian life
item.description: How the noble horse is at the heart of Romanian life
